card.name: Abyssal Gatekeeper
card.ability: When Abyssal Gatekeeper dies, each player sacrifices a creature.
card.flavor:
"There are two ways for me to pass this gate. One involves you remaining conscious."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The "sacrifice a creature" effect is not targeted. It can affect creatures with protection from black.
4/1/2008 : The player whose turn it is chooses a creature to sacrifice, then each other player in turn order chooses a creature to sacrifice, then all chosen creatures are sacrificed at the same time.

card.name: Abyssal Specter
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
card.flavor: To gaze under its hood is to invite death.

card.name: Akroma, Angel of Wrath
card.ability: Flying, first strike, vigilance, trample, haste, protection from black and from red
card.flavor: "Wrath is no vice when inflicted upon the deserving."

card.name: Angel of Mercy
card.ability:
Flying
When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
card.flavor: Every tear shed is a drop of immortality.

card.name: Angelic Benediction
card.ability:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, you may tap target creature.
card.flavor:
"Even in single combat, I am never alone."
—Rafiq of the Many
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If you declare exactly one creature as an attacker, each exalted ability on each permanent you control (including, perhaps, the attacking creature itself) will trigger. The bonuses are given to the attacking creature, not to the permanent with exalted. Ultimately, the attacking creature will wind up with +1/+1 for each of your exalted abilities.
10/1/2008 : If you attack with multiple creatures, but then all but one are removed from combat, your exalted abilities won't trigger.
10/1/2008 : Some effects put creatures onto the battlefield attacking. Since those creatures were never declared as attackers, they're ignored by exalted abilities. They won't cause exalted abilities to trigger. If any exalted abilities have already triggered (because exactly one creature was declared as an attacker), those abilities will resolve as normal even though there may now be multiple attackers.
10/1/2008 : Exalted abilities will resolve before blockers are declared.
10/1/2008 : Exalted bonuses last until end of turn. If an effect creates an additional combat phase during your turn, a creature that attacked alone during the first combat phase will still have its exalted bonuses in that new phase. If a creature attacks alone during the second combat phase, all your exalted abilities will trigger again.
10/1/2008 : In a Two-Headed Giant game, a creature "attacks alone" if it's the only creature declared as an attacker by your entire team. If you control that attacking creature, your exalted abilities will trigger but your teammate's exalted abilities won't.
7/1/2012 : The creature you target with the last ability will become tapped before blockers are declared.

card.name: Angelic Page
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: If only every message were as perfect as its bearer.

card.name: Angelic Protector
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Angelic Protector becomes the target of a spell or ability, Angelic Protector gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"My family sheltered in her light, the dark was content to wait."
—Crovax
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : The ability triggers when Angelic Protector is chosen as a target for a spell or ability. The Protectors ability will be put on the stack above that spell or ability, and so resolve first.

card.name: Angel's Feather
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor: If taken, it cuts the hand that clutches it. If given, it heals the hand that holds it.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a white spell.
10/1/2009 : If a player casts a white spell, Angel's Feather's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Angel's Feather's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

card.name: Angelsong
card.ability:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor: Clash of sword and cry of beast fall mute when angels sound the call to prayer.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Barren Moor
card.ability:
Barren Moor enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
Cycling {B} ({B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Barter in Blood
card.ability: Each player sacrifices two creatures.
card.flavor:
"In the game of conquest, who cares about the pawns if the king yet reigns?"
—Geth, keeper of the Vault
card.ruling:
5/1/2012 : The active player chooses which creatures will be sacrificed first, then each other player in turn order does the same. Then all creatures are sacrificed simultaneously.
5/1/2012 : If a player controls only one creature, that creature is sacrificed.
5/1/2012 : Barter in Blood doesn't target any creatures and may be cast even if a player controls fewer than two creatures.

card.name: Breeding Pit
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Breeding Pit unless you pay {B}{B}.
At the beginning of your end step, put a 0/1 black Thrull creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: The thrulls bred at a terrifying pace. In the end, they overwhelmed the Order of the Ebon Hand.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Breeding Pit must actually be on the battlefield at the beginning of the endstep in order for you to get a Thrull. The getting of the Thrull is not part of paying the upkeep, it is part of having the card on the battlefield.

card.name: Cackling Imp
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Target player loses 1 life.
card.flavor: Its laughter drives needles through your mind.

card.name: Charging Paladin
card.ability: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Hope shall be the blade that severs our bonds."

card.name: Consume Spirit
card.ability:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life.
card.flavor:
"Your blood, your marrow, your spirit—all are mine."
—Mayvar, minion of Geth
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : The amount of life you gain is equal to the number chosen for X, not the amount of damage Consume Spirit deals (in case some of it is prevented).
10/1/2009 : If the targeted creature or player is an illegal target by the time Consume Spirit would resolve, the entire spell is countered. You won't gain any life.

card.name: Corrupt
card.ability: Corrupt deals damage equal to the number of Swamps you control to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
card.flavor: There are things beneath the murk for whom the bog is a stew, a thin broth in need of meat.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The swamps are counted on resolution.
8/15/2010 : The life you gain is equal to the damage dealt by Corrupt, not necessarily to the number of Swamps you control (if some or all of the damage is prevented, for example).
8/15/2010 : The amount of damage dealt to a creature is not bounded by its toughness, and the amount of damage dealt to a player is not bounded by that player's life total. For example, if Corrupt deals 6 damage to a 2/2 creature, you'll gain 6 life.

card.name: Cruel Edict
card.ability: Target opponent sacrifices a creature.
card.flavor:
"Choose your next words carefully. They will be your last."
—Phage the Untouchable

card.name: Daggerclaw Imp
card.ability:
Flying
Daggerclaw Imp can't block.
card.flavor: The Simic use the claws as scalpels, while the Rakdos use them for tattooing and torture. The Gruul use them to pick their teeth after lunching on the rest of the carcass.

card.name: Dark Banishing
card.ability: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"Ha, banishment? Be merciful, say ‘death,'
For exile hath more terror in his look,
Much more than death."
—William Shakespeare, Romeo and Juliet

card.name: Dark Ritual
card.ability: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"Leshrac, my liege, grant me the power I am due."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

card.name: Demonic Tutor
card.ability: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Liliana learned the secrets she sought, but at a price that was etched on her fate.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You pick a card on resolution.
10/4/2004 : You don't reveal the card to your opponent.
10/4/2004 : This card is put directly into your hand. It is not drawn.

card.name: Demon's Horn
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Its curve mimics the twists of life and death.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a black spell.
10/1/2009 : If a player casts a black spell, Demon's Horn's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Demon's Horn's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

card.name: Demon's Jester
card.ability:
Flying
Hellbent — Demon's Jester gets +2/+1 as long as you have no cards in hand.
card.flavor: They knock 'em dead, with or without the punch line.

card.name: Duress
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
card.flavor: "Change your mind, or I'll change it for you."

card.name: Dusk Imp
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Imps are just intelligent enough to have an understanding of cruelty.

card.name: Faith's Fetters
card.ability:
Enchant permanent
When Faith's Fetters enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
Enchanted permanent's activated abilities can't be activated unless they're mana abilities. If enchanted permanent is a creature, it can't attack or block.
card.ruling: 10/1/2005 : Faith's Fetters doesn't stop static abilities, triggered abilities, or mana abilities from working. (A "mana ability" is an ability that produces mana, not an ability that costs mana.)

card.name: Fallen Angel
card.ability:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Why do you weep for the dead? I rejoice, for they have died for me."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can sacrifice itself.

card.name: Foul Imp
card.ability:
Flying
When Foul Imp enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life.
card.flavor: The imp, unaware of its own odor, paused to catch its breath . . . and promptly died.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can cast this if you have less than 2 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

card.name: Healing Salve
card.ability: Choose one — Target player gains 3 life; or prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

card.name: Icatian Priest
card.ability: {1}{W}{W}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Grelden knelt and felt the cool, dry hand of the priest on his brow. Hours later, when his wits returned, he was covered in his enemies' blood on the field of victory.

card.name: Kuro, Pitlord
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Kuro, Pitlord unless you pay {B}{B}{B}{B}.
Pay 1 life: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

card.name: Lord of the Pit
card.ability:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.
card.flavor: "My summoning begins your debt, planeswalker."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can select creatures with Protection from Black to be sacrificed.
10/4/2004 : If you have a creature, you must sacrifice it. The 7 damage can only be taken if no creature can be sacrificed.
10/4/2004 : If you have two Lords of the Pit, you can sacrifice them to each other.

card.name: Luminous Angel
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: "The spread of evil's destruction shall always be matched by the rise of the noble fallen."

card.name: Marble Diamond
card.ability:
Marble Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

card.name: Oni Possession
card.ability:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature.
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and has trample.
Enchanted creature is a Demon Spirit.

card.name: Otherworldly Journey
card.ability: Exile target creature. At the beginning of the next end step, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor:
"The landscape shimmered and I felt a chill breeze. When my vision cleared, I found myself alone among the corpses of my fallen friends."
—Journal found in Numai
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : The creature comes back onto the battlefield as a new creature, with one +1/+1 counter on it (plus any other counters that it would normally enter the battlefield with).
8/1/2005 : Unattached Auras are put into your graveyard as a state-based action, but Equipment remains on the battlefield, unattached.

card.name: Overeager Apprentice
card.ability: Discard a card, Sacrifice Overeager Apprentice: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Slow and steady may not always win the race, but at least it doesn't end up splattered on the walls.

card.name: Pacifism
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
card.flavor: Even those born to battle could only lay their blades at Akroma's feet.

card.name: Promise of Power
card.ability:
Choose one — You draw five cards and you lose 5 life; or put an X/X black Demon creature token with flying onto the battlefield, where X is the number of cards in your hand as the token enters the battlefield.
Entwine {4} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The power/toughness of the token is set when this spell resolves.
12/1/2004 : The power and toughness of the Demon token are set when Promise of Power resolves. They're unaffected if the number of cards in your hand changes later.
12/1/2004 : If you pay the entwine cost, you draw five cards, then lose five life, then put the Demon token onto the battlefield. The five cards you draw count toward the Demon's power and toughness.

card.name: Reiver Demon
card.ability:
Flying
When Reiver Demon enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, destroy all nonartifact, nonblack creatures. They can't be regenerated.

card.name: Reya Dawnbringer
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor: "You have not died until I consent."

card.name: Righteous Cause
card.ability: Whenever a creature attacks, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor:
"Until the world unites in vengeful fury and Phage is destroyed, I will not stay my hand."
—Akroma, angelic avenger

card.name: Secluded Steppe
card.ability:
Secluded Steppe enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
Cycling {W} ({W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Serra Advocate
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: An angel's blessing prepares a soldier for war better than a thousand military drills.

card.name: Serra Angel
card.ability:
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
card.flavor: Her sword sings more beautifully than any choir.

card.name: Serra's Boon
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2 as long as it's white. Otherwise, it gets -2/-1.
card.flavor:
"The light of an angel's glance is warm, but her fixed stare blinds and burns."
—Calexis, deacon of the New Order of Serra

card.name: Serra's Embrace
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying and vigilance.
card.flavor: The touch of Serra's angels bears hopes aloft and empowers noble causes.

card.name: Soot Imp
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever a player casts a nonblack spell, that player loses 1 life.
card.flavor:
"If one gets in your chimney, you're going to need a long wick and a barrel of bangstuff to get it out."
—Hob Heddil
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : This ability affects all players, including you.
8/1/2008 : A hybrid spell that's black and another color is *not* a nonblack spell. Since it's black, it can't be nonblack!

card.name: Souldrinker
card.ability: Pay 3 life: Put a +1/+1 counter on Souldrinker.
card.flavor: Don't drink and thrive.

card.name: Stinkweed Imp
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Stinkweed Imp deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature.
Dredge 5 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly five cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

card.name: Sustainer of the Realm
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Sustainer of the Realm blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: You may break her shield, but you'll never break her spirit.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It gets the bonus only once, not once per creature it blocks.

card.name: Twilight Shepherd
card.ability:
Flying, vigilance
When Twilight Shepherd enters the battlefield, return to your hand all cards in your graveyard that were put there from the battlefield this turn.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

card.name: Unholy Strength
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
card.flavor: Such power grows the body as it shrinks the soul.

card.name: Venerable Monk
card.ability: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
card.flavor: Age wears the flesh but galvanizes the soul.
